greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = Sum_{j=1..n-k+1} Stirling2(k, j).
comment: Rows of the array tend to A000110 starting (1, 2, 5, 15, 52,...).
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1275
formula: Take antidiagonals of an array formed by: A000012 * A008277(transform), where A000012 = (1; 1,1; 1,1,1;...) and A008277 = the Stirling2 triangle.
